intro: Tolpis virgata subsp. virgata, commonly known as the slender grassveld lily, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in grassland habitats and prefers well-drained soils. Its flowering period usually occurs in the summer months, adding ornamental value to its natural environment. Tolpis virgata subsp. virgata is often cultivated for its attractive appearance and is relatively easy to grow in suitable conditions.
